title: Social Security or VA file number
description: Follow this pattern to collect or display a person's Social Security Number or VA file number.

frontMatter.title: Social Security or VA file number
frontMatter.description: Follow this pattern to collect or display a person's Social Security Number or VA file number.
frontMatter.intro: Use this pattern when collecting or displaying identifying numbers for Veterans and non-Veterans, including Social Security Numbers (9 digits), VA file numbers (8-9 digits), and Military Service numbers.

when_to_use.value: **Collecting identity information.** When you need SSN or VA file number for application identification purposes.
**Displaying prefilled information.** When showing existing identity information to authenticated users.

design_principles.value: **Use single text input fields.** Do not split SSN into 3 separate input fields.
**Avoid abbreviations.** Use the full term 'Social Security number' rather than 'SSN'.
**Accept flexible formatting.** Allow spaces, dashes, or no formatting in user input.
**Auto-mask input.** Display with dashes upon blur for consistency.
**Prefill when possible.** Use existing data from VA systems when available.

when_not_to_use.value: **Already on file for IAL2 users.** When users are authenticated and identity-proofed with SSN already on file, use the prefilled information pattern instead.

examples.title: Collect SSN or VA file number
examples.description: Form fields requesting both Social Security and VA file numbers.

examples.title: Display prefilled information
examples.description: Card showing last four digits of Social Security number for verification.

how_to_build.intro: The pattern handles collection and display of sensitive identity numbers.

steps.value: Use single text input fields for SSN (not split into 3 parts).
Offer both SSN and VA file number fields for unauthenticated users.
For authenticated IAL2 users, SSN is uneditable when already on file.
For non-Veteran applicants, request only the applicable person's SSN.
Auto-mask input with dashes upon blur.
Validate appropriately based on expected format.

content_specs.hint_text: You must enter a Social Security number or VA file number
content_specs.error_message: Enter a valid 9-digit Social Security number (dashes allowed)
Enter a valid VA file number

accessibility.value: Use the formatNumberForScreenReader utility for proper screen reader announcement of masked numbers.
Ensure form fields have visible, associated labels.
Provide clear error messages that explain the expected format.
When displaying masked numbers, announce them in a screen reader friendly format.
